briefTitle: A Study to Test the Safety/ Efficacy of Brivaracetam (BRV) Used as Adjunctive Treatment in Subjects >=16 Years of Age With Partial Seizures With or Without Secondary Generalization
officialTitle: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Follow-up Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Brivaracetam Used as Adjunctive Treatment in Subjects >=16 Years of Age With Partial Seizures With or Without Secondary Generalization
conditions: Partial Seizures With or Without Secondary Generalization
summary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability of Brivaracetam (BRV) in focal epilepsy subjects with partial seizures and to evaluate the maintenance of efficacy of BRV over time.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From Baseline until end of the safety follow up (up to 88.5 months)
